verb.description: Conduct the policy, actions, and affairs of (a state, organization, or people)
examples: he was incapable of governing the country

verb.description: (of a word) require that (another word or group of words) be in a particular case.
examples: the Latin preposition “cum” governs nouns in the ablative

origin: Middle English: from Old French governer, from Latin gubernare to steer, rule, from Greek kubernan to steer.
